titleStmt.title: The proud pharisee reproved: or, the lying orator laid open. In an examination of some passages in a book, entituled, precepts for Christian practice, or, the rule of the new creature new model'd. Written by one Edw. Reyner, who calles himself a minister of the Gospel in Lincoln; but is found a lyar / by a Child of the light, who is known to the world by the name of Martin Mason.
titleStmt.author: Mason, Martin, fl. 1650-1676.

titleStmt.title: The proud pharisee reproved: or, the lying orator laid open. In an examination of some passages in a book, entituled, precepts for Christian practice, or, the rule of the new creature new model'd. Written by one Edw. Reyner, who calles himself a minister of the Gospel in Lincoln; but is found a lyar / by a Child of the light, who is known to the world by the name of Martin Mason.
titleStmt.author: Mason, Martin, fl. 1650-1676.

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Reyner, Edward. Precepts for Christian practice.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
